subject: Physical Fitness
title: Fat as Muscle Fuel
description: A fast breakdown of Fat as Muscle Fuel for builders.

hook.text: A lean person carries enough body fat to fuel dozens of marathons. The supply is nearly limitless.

buildup.text: Fat delivers 9 calories per gram â€” more than twice what carbs provide. It's energy-dense but slow to burn.

discovery.text: Muscles break fat into fatty acids, then oxidize them in mitochondria. It requires oxygen and patience.

twist.text: At high intensities, fat burning drops because oxygen can't keep up. Carbs take over as the faster fuel.

climax.text: Endurance training doubles the fat-burning rate at the same pace. Fit people are better fat-burners.

punchline.text: Fat is slow fuel. But for long efforts, nothing else comes close.

quiz.question: Why does fat burning decrease at high exercise intensity?
options: Oxygen supply can't keep up with demand
Muscles reject fatty acids at high speeds
